intro: [WRONG START] Prunus cerasas flore-roseo-pleno, commonly known as the pink-flowered cherry or double pink cherry, is a cultivar of the sweet cherry tree. It is characterized by its profuse, double blooms that appear in early spring, with petals that are pink in color. The plant is a deciduous shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of 3 to 6 meters. Its leaves are oval-shaped and have a serrated margin, turning yellow in the fall. The fruit is a small, sweet cherry that ripens in late summer.
